cpabc_current_candidates_experience_v1.title: CPA BC Current Candidates Experience Requirements
cpabc_current_candidates_experience_v1.summary: Comprehensive guide covering practical experience requirements for CPA BC candidates, including PERT system access, competency demonstration, and route-specific guidance.
key_topics: 30 months minimum paid, relevant, progressive work experience
Core, depth, and breadth technical competencies

requirements: Pre-Assessment Checklist for EVR candidates available
documentation: Job change forms between EVR and PPR routes
Public accounting chargeable hours submission form

technical_competencies.breadth_requirement: Eight competencies at Level 1 or greater, four at Level 2

competency_framework.enabling_competencies: Professional skills and behaviors checklist provided
competency_framework.progression_timeline: Two technical sub-competencies at Level 1 within 12 months

pert_system_details.user_guide: PERT User Guide for Future CPAs available

pert_self_assessment_tool_v1.title: PERT Self-Assessment Tool
pert_self_assessment_tool_v1.summary: Interactive tool for CPA candidates to evaluate their practical experience progress across six technical competency areas with proficiency level selection.
key_topics: Examples and guidance for each competency

prerequisites: Working in position allowing experience in at least one technical sub-competency
Accepted as future CPA by provincial/regional body
progression_milestones: Level 1 proficiency in one technical sub-competency to start
Two technical sub-competencies at Level 1 within 12 months
Eight competencies at Level 1 or greater (four at Level 2)
Depth in at least one competency area
Core competencies in Financial Reporting and/or Management Accounting

linked_resources: Guiding Questions and Practical Experience Rubric (CPA Canada)
pert_self_assessment_tool_v1.disclaimer: Tool is for self-assessment purposes only. No experience will be recognized toward meeting the CPA Practical Experience Requirements.
